message: Hope everyone has a safe and enjoyable start to 2017!
So exciting to see the Grove City High School Marching Band in the Tournament of Roses - Rose Parade today! #grovecity #roseparade South-Western City School District

Drug-free clubs are a great way to incentivize high school students to say “no” to drugs. Thank you to Pickerington Schools - PLSD and Tyler's Light for supporting this important initiative to stop the cycle of drug abuse in our communities. Read more in the Lancaster Eagle-Gazette here: http://ohne.ws/2iX4aXm

It is my honor to serve in the 115th Congress, and I look forward to working with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to pass policies that will make America stronger and more prosperous. #OpeningDay

My #NewYearsResolution for the 115th Congress? Keep fighting to provide Americans with a #BetterWay to address their health care concerns.  You deserve to choose the plan that best fits your healthcare needs, and access to the life-saving treatments our nation has to offer.  Read more here: http://bit.ly/2hNrkDs
Great meeting today with the Deputy Whip Team. Looking forward to working with all of you in the 115th Congress!
I think we all can agree, #Ohioan Grant Kessler made a great first impression! #DressedtoImpress http://usat.ly/2iaTEvD

The action taken by the United Nations condemning Israel’s presence in the West Bank was unprecedented.  President Obama refused to veto the resolution, but today I proudly voted to oppose the action and join the House of Representatives in calling for a repeal.

Congratulations, Congressman Warren Davidson, and welcome! Together with Joyce Beatty and the rest of the House Committee on Financial Services, let’s create economic opportunity for Ohio and the rest of the nation. Read more in The Columbus Dispatch: http://bit.ly/2hYRXjO

I was EXTREMELY proud & privileged to nominate outstanding students to West Point - The U.S. Military Academy United States Naval Academy US Air Force Academy (Official) & United States Merchant Marine Academy for the Class of 2021. These students will represent our region well and will undoubtedly contribute to making our military stronger. I want to thank them for their wiliness to serve and also to thank my Military Academy Review Board for their work in interviewing the students and making recommendations.  For more information on how to apply for service academy nominations, please visit my website: http://stivers.house.gov/cons…/serviceacademynominations.htm

It's not a flying car, but I think Marty McFly would approve. Columbus is a finalist for a new, futuristic transportation system. Read more in The Columbus Dispatch: http://bit.ly/2i7QsEU   cc: Mid-Ohio Regional Planning Commission (MORPC)

Check out these #StoriesFromOhio and around the country about how Obamacare has affected patients, families, millennials,  self-employed individuals, small business owners and retirees. Looking forward to working with Representative Pat Tiberi and the entire Committee on Ways and Means on a #BetterWay for Ohio and our nation. http://bit.ly/2j8cgjz

For 100 years, Girls Scouts of America and their legendary cookies have given girls the encourageMINT to THINk for themselves and be leaders in their communities.  As an Eagle Scout myself, I want to say congratulations, and here's to another 100 delicious years!
Today's vote is the first step in creating the health care system we need: a patient-centered approach that will bring back choice and lower costs across the board. http://bit.ly/2ilTGVq

Do you need help working with the IRS, Department of Veterans Affairs, or Social Security? My office can help! Click here to learn more about how my office can assist you with issues you have before federal agencies -> http://bit.ly/1EfQg9p

Honored to join Representative Joyce Beatty this morning to recognize AEP Ohio and the U.S. Army PaYS program for their commitment to helping #veterans find #jobs and transition back to civilian life.
Glad to have so many great Ohioans visiting the office for #Inauguration2017 #OH15
Be sure to tune in throughout the morning and afternoon to witness all of the #Inauguration2017 events. #InaugurationDay
Honored to have the opportunity this morning to witness the swearing in of our 45th President of the United States. #InaugurationDay
Today, we were fortunate to come together as a nation and witness a pillar of our democracy: the peaceful transfer of power.   Read my full statement here: http://bit.ly/2jW2yyf

Want to skip the line and keep your shoes on for your next flight? Sign-up for the TSA PreCheck enrollment center at the John Glenn Columbus International Airport. Click here for more information: http://bit.ly/2dWVoaP
Today, President Donald J. Trump allowed the #KeystoneXL pipeline to finally move forward so America can move toward energy independence and create more #jobs.
We are just getting started in the 115th Congress, and we have plenty of work ahead of us.  I want your input.  What issue is most important to you?  Let me know: http://bit.ly/2kkrZK4.
As a reminder, while I value and encourage an open discussion on my wall, please note that posts will be removed that contain swearing or personal attacks on others posting to the wall.
This Week in Congress: January 30, 2017

Holding degrees from Columbia, Harvard Law School and Oxford, and serving in the 10th Circuit Court of Appeals, there is no doubt that Judge Gorsuch has the education and experience to serve on the United States Supreme Court. I want to congratulate Judge Gorsuch on his nomination, and I hope the Senate will quickly move forward on his confirmation.

The 115th Congress has started its second month, and as we are addressing issues important to our nation,  I want your input.  What issue is most important to you?  Let me know: http://bit.ly/2kkrZK4.

Small businesses are the backbone of our society – I’m committed to getting the government off their backs.  In the first few weeks of the 115th Congress, the House of Representatives has already taken action to rein-in onerous federal regulations, cut red tape and provide relief to job creators.  Read more here: http://bit.ly/2kXemE7

I look forward to a time where Iran is a constructive international actor so that we can lift sanctions. However, with their aggressive behavior, record of supporting terrorist organizations, and nuclear proliferation, I believe the new sanctions announced today are not only necessary, but overdue. http://bit.ly/2jHkRLn
This Week in Congress: Monday, February 06, 2017

We owe it to our veterans to ensure they receive the care they need when they return home. I am proud to join Representative Dave Loebsack in reintroducing the Never Again Act because no veteran should ever be turned away when asking for in-patient psychiatric care.  Read the full release here: http://bit.ly/2kIFzKd

Teletown Halls are my favorite way to keep in touch with the people in the 15th District while I’m here in Washington.  Glad we got to talk healthcare, infrastructure, and jobs last night.  It’s always great to hear from you all!

In the 21st century, broadband access is no longer a convenience - it's a necessity. Thanks to all who attended today's forum for their participation and their commitment to closing the digital divide in Southeast Ohio.

This awesome mother-daughter duo from #OH15 had a great time exploring the Capitol today.   Are you visiting D.C. soon? My office can help arrange tours that are fun for the whole family! http://bit.ly/Pwy45w
Be sure to tune into WBNS-10TV - Columbus, Ohio Face The State with Scott Light this morning, where I will be a guest panelist talking about the issues facing Ohio and our nation.
This Week in Congress: Monday, February 13, 2017
I had a great time at my Constituent Coffee this morning. Glad to have the opportunity to meet and talk with the folks from Ohio while the legislative calendar keeps me busy in D.C.

"If your actions inspire others to dream more, learn more, do more, and become more, you are a leader." -John Quincy Adams  Today, we celebrate our first President, George Washington, those who have served our nation from the Oval Office, and all those who embrace the spirit of leadership and service.  Happy Presidents' Day.
Tax season is quickly approaching, do you need help with the IRS? Having trouble with a passport? My office may be able to help, give us a call. http://bit.ly/2kt2LYV
Thank you Columbus Chamber of Commerce for hosting last night's event.  Great chance to get to know the business leaders in our community.
Very excited to see the progress at Nationwide Children's Livingston Ambulatory Center here in Ohio's 15th District and discuss important issues in healthcare reform.
I am inspired by the work these men and Save A Warrior are doing to end the suicide epidemic among their fellow veterans. We have a moral obligation to serve those who have served our nation.
Today, I had lunch with a group of smart, driven businesswomen from Ohio's 15th District. I'm proud to support NAWBO and the work they do to grow our local economy and provide jobs.

Spent a great afternoon in Circleville. I know Mayor McIlroy and I were both excited to see the progress at Ohio Christian University's Innovation Center, and I'm looking forward to the opportunities Sofidel's new facility will bring to the community. Big things are happening in Pickaway County!
This Week in Congress: Monday, February 27, 2017
Love seeing students from my alma mater, The Ohio State University, getting involved in public policy.  Hope you all enjoyed your tour of the Capitol last week.  Go Bucks!

Today, we celebrate the 214th Anniversary of Ohio’s Statehood.  I am so proud to call Ohio home, and to have the opportunity to represent my fellow Ohioans in Congress.  Since 1803, the Buckeye State has represented the best our nation has to offer; it has given countless people the opportunity to build their homes and find their piece of the American Dream.  Happy Birthday, Ohio!
Talked tuberous sclerosis, Rare Disease Day, and Land and Water Conservation reauthorization at yesterday's constituent coffee.  Thanks for stopping by!

Inspiring story from London, OH in The Columbus Dispatch.  It’s amazing to see how a community comes together to support one another, and I am excited for all the children who will be able to enjoy Noah’s Playground.  http://bit.ly/2lN7aIp
This Week in Congress: Monday, March 6, 2017

Last month, I held a Digital Divide Roundtable in Southeast Ohio.  Now, I'm looking forward to collaborating with community leaders and representatives from organizations like Connect Ohio, the USDA, and the FCC to work towards universal broadband access.  Here in Washington, I will also be working to ensure that any infrastructure bill we consider will include funding to help bridge the digital divide.  http://bit.ly/2lOnYNL
D.C.'s famous cherry blossoms are expected to be in full bloom this month.  Are you coming to Washington to see them?  My office can help coordinate tours for you. http://bit.ly/1uKF4N6
This Week in Congress: Monday, March 13, 2017

No child should ever be without a home, let alone be forced to navigate bureaucratic red tape just to prove that they are actually homeless.  I am committed to alleviating this issue and helping to serve those children.  It was great to spend time at Huckleberry House, Inc. and see their efforts in combating homelessness.  I am also proud to reintroduce the Homeless Children and Youth Act.  Read more here: http://bit.ly/2mJTLDi
Thanks to all who participated in tonight's Teletown Hall.  I apologize for the late start, votes on the floor ran longer than anticipated.  It was great to hear from the constituents of Ohio's 15th.

Had a productive meeting with some of my younger constituents this morning. Great discussion on donuts and Capitol fun facts.  Thanks for stopping by my Constituent Coffee, and I hope you enjoy the rest of your spring break.
This Week in Congress: Monday, March 20, 2017
For four years, Vinton County has been without access to healthy foods. Today’s ground breaking for Campbell’s Market is a huge step towards ending the county's food desert. http://bit.ly/2nLCXu1

Congratulations to Molly Frey, of Pickerington High School, for being named one of six Military Children of the Year.  Molly is a very impressive young lady, and absolutely deserving of this honor.  http://bit.ly/2mQ0iw6
This Week in Congress: Monday, March 27, 2017

Spring break season is in full force and we’re excited so many are choosing to spend it here in D.C. – great to meet some folks visiting from Ohio’s 15th.  Also, a special congratulations to Mark who was sworn in as a member of the Bar of the Supreme Court yesterday.

Proud to see my alma mater The Ohio State University recognized for its outstanding graduate programs.  My MBA has definitely given me a great foundation.  Keep up the good work. http://bit.ly/2mlLNl7

Are you or someone you know looking for a job? My 2017 Job Fair will be on Monday, April 10 at the campus of The Ohio State University from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Admission and parking is FREE and there will be over 70 employers with thousands of open positions to fill. For a list of employers and more, click below: http://bit.ly/2nW2Zd8
This Week in Congress: Monday, April 3, 2017

As a veteran of Operation Iraqi Freedom, I understand the need to educate people on our military, and to share and preserve the stories of the incredible sacrifices our veterans make for our freedoms.  I’m proud to work with Representative Joyce Beatty and Representative Pat Tiberi to support the Veterans Memorial and Museum in Columbus.  Read more here: http://bit.ly/2nb3Qe6
Thanks to the students from Ohio University's Heritage College of Osteopathic Medicine for meeting with me yesterday and discussing important issues like primary care, research, and public health.

The 2017 Job Fair is underway. We'll be at The Ohio State University's 4-H Center until 4 PM - employers are looking to fill thousands of positions. If you, or someone you know is seeking employment, we hope to see you today.
Great to meet some of the applicants here today - lots of connections being made.
And that's a wrap on the 7th Annual Job Fair. Thanks to all the employers and job seekers who participated.

Did you know April is Financial Literacy Month?  Last week, Representative Joyce Beatty and I introduced HRes 243 to recognize the goals of Financial Literacy Month: to encourage the financial health of all Americans and to educate on topics like budgeting, personal finance, retirement, etc.  For the rest of April, I will be sharing information about these important topics because understanding financial decisions is key to building a successful future.
Thanks to everyone who stopped by to see our new Lancaster office, I'm excited to have this new space to work for the people of #OH15.
To all those celebrating this Easter Sunday and those who are in the midst of celebrating Passover, I hope you have a peaceful day spent with family and friends.

Have you finished your taxes? Already received your refund? Consider putting it into a savings account - it's never to early or too late to prepare for an emergency, furthering your education, or retirement. #FLM2017
Good news for veterans in the Columbus area - starting on May 1st, the Columbus VA Urgent Care Center will be open 7 days a week.  They have served our nation, now it is our turn to serve them.
I'm excited to see the progress made at Buckeye Lake, and grateful to Ohio Department of Natural Resources for all their hard work.
Productive conversations today with constituents from #OH15. Thanks for taking the time to meet with me and share your perspectives.

Good article today from The Columbus Dispatch regarding broadband access. Over a fourth of Americans do not have access in their homes, we have to keep working to bridge this divide. http://bit.ly/2pMQcvf
This Week in Congress: Monday, April 24, 2017

I was surprised and humbled by the speeches made by my colleagues this afternoon.  It is an honor to serve the people of the United States in both the Army and Congress, as well as to serve with such a great delegation.  I also want to extend my congratulations to Rep. Brad Wenstrup who was also recently promoted to the rank of Colonel in the Army Reserve.  Brad is a true patriot.  http://bit.ly/2oxgLrl

This Saturday, April 29th, is National Prescription Drug Take Back Day.  According to the National Institute on Drug Abuse, 70 percent of adults who misuse prescription opioids find them in their friends’ and relatives’ medicine cabinets.  You can help fight this epidemic by getting unused prescriptions out of your cabinet and making sure that they are properly disposed of.   As part of the Take Back Initiative, the Drug Enforcement Administration, in conjunction with many local Sheriff’s offices and other community partners, are hosting sites where prescriptions can be dropped off.  Below is a list of the registered sites within the 15th District that are participating this Saturday.  ATHENS COUNTY:   Ohio Health O’Bleness Hospital 55 Hospital Drive Athens, OH 45701  CLINTON COUNTY:  Foster J Boyd MD Regional Cancer Center 31 Farquhar Sabina, OH 45169  Uhal’s Iga Market 440 E Washington St Sabina, OH 45169  FAIRFIELD COUNTY:   Fairfield County Sheriff’s Office Violet Township Maintenance Garage 490 N Center (at the corner of N Center and Stemen Rd) Pickerington, OH 43147  Pickerington Police Department 1311 Refugee Rd Pickerington, OH 43147  Lancaster Police Department at Ohio University 1570 Granville Pike Lancaster, OH 43130  FAYETTE COUNTY:   Fayette County Sheriff’s Annex Building 110 West Market Street Washington Court House, OH 43160  FRANKLIN COUNTY:   Kroger 4656 Cemetery Rd Hilliard, OH 43026  Hilliard Division of Police 5171 Northwest Parkway Hilliard, OH 43026  Franklin Township Police Department/Franklin Township Fire Department 2193 Frank Rd Columbus, OH 43223  Kroger 2090 Crown Plaza Dr Columbus, OH 43235  Kroger 1375 Chambers Rd Columbus, OH 43212  Jackson Township Fire Department Station 202 3650 Hoover Rd Grove City, OH 43123  Diley Ridge Medical Center Parking Lot 7911 Diley Rd Canal Winchester, OH 43110  Kroger 6095 Gender Rd Canal Winchester, OH 43110  Kroger 3637 S High St Columbus, OH 43027  Columbus Health Department 240 Parsons Ave Columbus, OH 43215  Upper Arlington Police Division Municipal Services Center 3600 Tremont Road Upper Arlington, OH 43221  HOCKING COUNTY  Hocking County Sheriff’s Office 25 E Second Street Logan, OH 43138  MADISON COUNTY  Pleasant Valley Fire Department 650 W Main Street Plain City, OH 43064  Madison County Sheriff’s Office 222 Garfield Street London, OH 43140  ROSS  Ross County Law Complex 28 N Paint St Chillicothe, OH 45601  For constituents in MORGAN, PERRY, PICKAWAY, AND VINTON COUNTY, please contact your local Sheriff’s office for information about prescription disposal.   Ohio is facing an opioid epidemic, and it will take collaboration from officials, and community members to help those affected.  This is a small way to make a big impact.
Safe travels to the 56 Clinton County veterans heading to Washington, DC tomorrow with the Wilmington Honor Flight. Thank you for your service.
This Week in Congress: Monday, May 01, 2017
Very excited to be a part of the ribbon cutting for the Carroll 33 Interchange. It's an important infrastructure project that will improve the commutes for those in Ohio's 15th.
Kicked off Teacher Appreciation Week by sending thank-you notes to some amazing educators in the 15th District. This week, consider reaching out to thank a teacher who has had an impact in your life.

Today, the House Committee on Financial Services is taking steps to ensure accountability for big banks, and to provide opportunities for consumers.  You can learn more about the Financial CHOICE Act at financialchoice.gop.

No veteran should ever find themselves without a home, but unfortunately that population is particularly vulnerable to homelessness. Congress has a responsibility to act, which is why I've partnered with Rep. Joyce Beatty to reintroduce the HOMeS Act. You can read more about the legislation here:  http://bit.ly/2q09BfJ
Great to sit down with 10TV - WBNS this morning. Tune in on Sunday to hear about the issues we're working on in Congress, including health care and student loans.
‪On #NationalTeacherDay, I want to recognize Chillicothe's own and Ohio's 2017 Teacher of the Year, Dustin Weaver. Thank you for your hard work and dedication, Dustin.  #ThankATeacherOH‬

Thanks to the Wilmington veterans who participated in today's roundtable. I really appreciate your perspective on the issues facing the veteran community; good discussion on the Veterans Choice program and the VA appeals process.

Great having Barek spend the day with me yesterday to learn more about government and Congress.  An 8th grader at Clinton Massie Middle School, he says he wants to attend a military academy and maybe, one day, law school. Keep working hard, Barek!

Thanks to Fairfield County Sheriff Phalen for showing me around the new jail. Glad that our law enforcement officers will have the resources they need to protect our community. #NationalPoliceWeek2017
This Week in Congress: Monday, May 15, 2017
As #NationalPoliceWeek2017 continues, it is an honor to recognize all those who protect our communities, and to cosponsor legislation to support them. Read more here: http://bit.ly/2rfWib3
Thanks to the senior class of Plainview Christian High School for stopping by this morning. Interested in a Capitol tour? My office can help: http://bit.ly/Pwy45w

Ohio's 15th district is the site of many important infrastructure projects. Here, and in the rest of Central Ohio, we know it's #TimeToBuild, and we couldn't do it without the engineers, like Jeremiah Upp from Fairfield County. As we recognize National Infrastructure Week, I want to show my appreciation for the men and women who make projects like Smart Columbus and the Carroll 33 Interchange possible. Together, we can tackle tough infrastructure issues, like the digital divide and road maintenance, and keep America moving forward.

As students from The Ohio State University, Ohio Christian University, Ohio University, and Wilmington College graduate this month, I introduced legislation to help alleviate some of the stress that can accompany student loan debt. You can read more about the bill here: http://bit.ly/2q2ia5T

In light of the tragic attack in Manchester last night, I want to extend my prayers to the victims and their families, and my thanks to the first responders.  These senseless acts of violence should only strengthen our determination in the fight against terrorism.
Thanks to Ohio University for hosting the Sixth Annual Appalachian Ohio State of the Region Conference.  Building economic resiliency is an important goal for our area and our families. #SOTR #jobs

Great meeting today with the Columbus Zoo and Aquarium and some of Ohio's furriest residents. I'm proud to support our zoos and aquariums so that everyone can continue to learn about and enjoy these amazing animals.

As we begin Memorial Day Weekend, we take time to reflect on those soldiers who have laid down their lives to protect our nation and our values. In the 15th District and across the country, people will remember their neighbors, friends, and loved ones who did not come home.   Yesterday, I had the honor to pay tribute to those brave men and women by placing a wreath with my colleague and fellow Army veteran, Congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard. This Memorial Day, take a moment to thank the veterans in your lives, and a moment to reflect those who have made the ultimate sacrifice.

Throughout Ohio's 15th District, people are pausing to remember the members of their communities who have lost their lives in defense of our country and its values. I was especially honored to be a part of the ceremony at Wesley Cemetery, hosted by American Legion Post 614 and VWF Post 4931.

Throughout Ohio's 15th District, people are pausing to remember the members of their communities who have lost their lives in defense of our country and its values. I was especially honored to be a part of the ceremony at Wesley Cemetery, hosted by American Legion Post 614 and VWF Post 4931.

Thanks to Reeb Avenue Center for showing me around, but more importantly thank you for the amazing work the staff  here is undertaking to benefit the South Side of Columbus. From child care and adult education to community development and health, Reeb Avenue Center and its partners are certainly a hub of hope.
Excited to see the continued development in Grandview Heights. The growth in this neighborhood certainly highlights the benefits of living in Central Ohio and #OH15. http://bit.ly/2qfBssW

Congratulations to Chase and Henry from Bloom-Carroll Local School District. This weekend, they were two of 75 young inventors from Ohio who competed in the National Invention Convention and Entrepreneurship Expo. Before they presented their Balloon Bouquet Stem, they stopped by the Capitol. Here they are with another Ohio-born inventor - Thomas Edison.
This Week in Congress: Tuesday, June 6, 2017

Thanks to Stan and Gigi at La Chatelaine French Bakery & Bistro for hosting their annual event commemorating the anniversary of D-Day. They help to ensure that the sacrifices of our WWII veterans and the Greatest Generation are not forgotten.
A warm welcome for our veterans returning home to #OH15 from their Honor Flight this weekend.
This Week in Congress: Monday, June 12, 2017
If we're not connected, we're underserving families and businesses in #OH15. New data from Connect Ohio, click here: http://bit.ly/2spHnMs

An attack on one of us is an attack on all of us. I condemn today's horrific attack on the Republican Baseball Team this morning. I pray for the victims, and thank the first responders for their efforts to respond and save lives. I hope we can all maintain civility in our politics. We can disagree on issues without personally attacking each other.
A belated happy birthday to the U.S. Army. 242 years of protecting our nation and our freedoms, 242 years of #ArmyStrong.

Do you know an outstanding veteran who has gone above and beyond to serve their community even after their time in the military? The Ohio Veterans Hall of Fame is accepting applications for its 2017 Class until June 30th. More info here: http://bit.ly/2taqX83
Tune in to Columbus On The Record tonight at 8:30 PM. Discussing the news of the day with Mike Thompson.
This Week in Congress: Monday, June 19, 2017

Very excited to see the progress at the Veterans Memorial project in downtown Columbus, and happy to work with my colleagues from Central Ohio Rep. Joyce Beatty and Rep. Pat Tiberi to pass H.Res.1900 to designate the facility as the National Veterans Memorial and Museum. This Memorial will give the public the opportunity to both learn about our nation's military and to share the incredible stories of the sacrifices our veterans have made for our freedoms.
ICYMI: See footage courtesy of NBC4 of the new National Veterans Memorial & Museum. Wonderful tour of an attraction that will bring many to the Columbus area.

Productive meeting with constituents from #OH15 who are a part of the Pancreatic Cancer Action Network - Columbus Affiliate. In 2016, pancreatic cancer surpassed breast cancer as the 3rd-leading cause of cancer-related death. That is why I'm proud to be a part of the Congressional Caucus on Deadliest Cancers, and the co-chair of the Biomedical Research Caucus. Both advocate for funding for the National Institutes of Health so that we can find cures to these terrible diseases.
Congratulations to all the SIFMA #CapitolHillChallenge winners. I am sure that your skill and interest in investments will compound over the years and pay dividends in your future.

After last night's Teletown Hall, I made follow up calls to some of the nearly 22,000 constituents who were reached. Some needed help with a federal agency, others were eager to share their perspective on the issues facing Congress, and I was glad to hear from them all. If you have a comment or a question, never hesitate to contact my offices in the District or in Washington DC.  Hilliard: (614) 771-4968 Lancaster: (740) 654-2654 Wilmington: (937) 283-7049 Washington DC: (202) 225-2015

Congratulations to the 33 graduates of the Athens County Prosecutor's Office's drug court program. Programs like these have a huge impact in improving our communities by reducing crime and drug use. But more importantly, they can have a real effect in the lives of our neighbors, like these grads. The support that drug courts provide can change lives and are a great tool in fighting the nation's drug epidemic. http://bit.ly/2sTrR9k‬
This Week in Congress: Monday, June 26, 2017
Infrastructure benefits everyone. That's why it is one of my top priorities for #OH15 this Congress. bit.ly/2thKmGI

Joseph Carter Corbin was not just an educator, but a trailblazer. I'm excited to see this new historical marker unveiled at Ohio University Chillicothe to serve as a reminder of his work. For more information about this Chillicothe native and this project, click here: http://bit.ly/2siyy7L

This week, young artists from all over the country traveled to see their work displayed in the halls of our nation's Capitol. I want to congratulate all of the winners of the Congressional Art Competition, especially Cassidy, whose art will be representing #OH15 for the second year in a row. http://bit.ly/2tyxWLt

I am honored to be a part of the celebration of McConnelsville's bicentennial. For 200 years, McConnelsville has celebrated community, faith, and freedom.  It is a privilege to represent a village where the core values of our nation are exemplified.
Today, we celebrate independence, freedom, community and all that our incredible nation has to offer.  Wishing you and your family a safe and happy holiday.
Great to see young professionals coming together to better their community.  I can’t wait to see all that this ambitious group will accomplish in Madison County. http://bit.ly/2tpCD7k

Great piece by The Humane Society of the United States about the important role that service dogs can play in helping veterans who are struggling with PTSD.  Proud to join with my colleague Rep. Tim Walz (D-MN), and many others in the House to work on legislation that supports these valuable partnerships. http://bit.ly/2tm0I0h

Extremely grateful for our outstanding summer interns and the hard work they do for the people of #OH15. Applications for fall internships are still open, click here for more information: http://bit.ly/2uJB6Js
This Week in Congress: Tuesday, July 11, 2017
If you, or someone you know, are considering attending a service academy for college, now is the time to begin the process.  Click here for more information: http://bit.ly/2vcmzWe

Glad to have the opportunity to meet Chillicothe native Eric-Paul Tatum. Eric is a student at Wright State University who participated in the Summer Undergraduate Research Fellowship with the National Institute of Standards and Technology. Innovation is key to growing our economy, and young scientists like Eric are the leaders and the future of their fields.
Strong storms are expected in #OH15 and all around Ohio tonight, everyone stay safe.

Great to meet an exceptional student from Grove City, Maggan Shaikh. Maggan is part of the Capitol Leadership Academy; he has spent the past week learning about civic engagement and the political process, how to engage with elected officials, and even run for office himself one day. I know he will do big things in #OH15.
This Week in Congress: Monday, July 17, 2017

Congressman Regula devoted his life to serving the people of Ohio. In his nearly four decades in the House, he offered leadership and an excellent example of what it means to be a public servant.  My thoughts are with his wife, Mary, and the rest of his family.

If you are a Pickerington homeowner who was impacted by the flooding last week, please be sure contact the City Manager TODAY so your information can be included in the request for assistance from the state. Please share this with any family or friends that were affected. More information from WSYX ABC 6: http://bit.ly/2uIJ4F5

I am honored to recognize the centennial of the 37th Infantry Brigade Combat Team of the Ohio Army National Guard.  From WWI to Iraq and Afghanistan, the Buckeye Brigade has been bravely defending our nation for 100 years.  And to those currently deployed in support of Operation Joint Guard-Kosovo Force, thank you for your service and come home safe. http://bit.ly/2tOhxy4
This Week in Congress: Monday, July 24, 2017

We cannot stand idly by while nations demonstrate a consistent and blatant disregard for the rules. I am proud to join with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to take action in response to three countries that clearly do not have the best interests of the United States in mind and pass the Russia, Iran, and North Korea Sanctions Act.

The arts can have huge, positive impacts in our communities, and as a member of the Congressional Arts Caucus, I'm committed to supporting organizations that bring culture and education to their neighborhoods.  I recently sent a letter in support of the Perry County Historical Society, and I'm excited to see what they accomplish in #OH15 with this grant from the Ohio Arts Council.   If you are applying for a grant, my office may be able to help - call my Lancaster office at (740) 654-2654.  http://bit.ly/2v95XCJ

Today, I had the privilege to testify before the House Judiciary Committee about the bill I introduced with U.S. Congressman Henry Cuellar (TX-28), H. Res. 110, the Balanced Budget Amendment. From keeping our nation from bankruptcy and ensuring fiscal solvency, to protecting programs that many members of our society depend on, people across the political spectrum will see the necessity of this resolution.
Great story from NBC4 about the 121st Air Refueling Wing making a dream come true with the Pilot for a Day Program. Proud to serve in the Ohio National Guard. bit.ly/2u5r0kI
Honored to welcome home members of the 37th Brigade Combat Team today. Thank you for your incredible service to our country.

This Saturday, October 28th, is National Prescription Drug Take Back Day.  According to the National Institute on Drug Abuse, 70 percent of adults who misuse prescription opioids find them in their friends’ and relatives’ medicine cabinets.  You can help fight this epidemic by getting unused prescriptions out of your cabinet and making sure that they are properly disposed of.  As part of the Take Back Initiative, the Drug Enforcement Administration, in conjunction with many local Sheriff’s offices and other community partners, are hosting sites where prescriptions can be dropped off.  Below is a list of the registered sites within the 15th District that are participating this Saturday. 47,640. That is the number of veterans currently living in the 15th Congressional District. And there are thousands more who are actively serving our nation in the military today fighting for the principles, freedoms, and liberties we are so lucky to enjoy. And there are countless more whose dedication, service, and sacrifice live on in the memories of those who knew them best.   This project is a collection of their stories. No two stories are alike; they span across the district – from Madison County to Morgan County, and they span across eras – from the First World War to the War on Terror. For most, their time in the military was positive and gratifying, for some, it was more difficult. Regardless, their service impacted each of them, and it impacts all of us. All those who serve deserve the recognition and thanks of our entire nation.   As a Brigadier General in the Ohio Army National Guard, and as your Representative in Congress, I have had the pleasure to meet many service members and veterans over the years. I believe that telling their stories is one of the best and most important ways to honor their sacrifice. I want to thank everyone who has been a part of this project, and I hope you will join me in thanking the Faces of the 15th.   Sincerely,   Steve Stivers  If you would like to purchase a copy of Faces of the 15th, please follow this link or contact my Washington, D.C. office at 202-225-2015.  http://bit.ly/2zKmD2H

In today’s competitive job market, older Americans can often be overlooked and left without resources to help find work. That is why my office is hosting a workshop geared toward job seekers over the age of 50 on Monday, December 4 from 3 p.m. to 6 p.m. at Upper Arlington City Hall.  Experts from organizations such as Goodwill, Jewish Family Services, Ohio Means Jobs, and Employment for Seniors will be on hand for resume writing reviews, employment resources, and workshop sessions. All interested mature job seekers are invited to attend. Please RSVP to the Hilliard District Office at 614-771-4968.

Each year, December 21 is recognized as Homeless Persons' Memorial Day.  It gives us the opportunity to reflect on a systemic problem and to consider solutions that would make this day unnecessary.   This Congress, I have sponsored two bills with the goal of connecting vulnerable populations with the resources they need:   The Homeless Children and Youth Act seeks to identify the scope of youth homelessness and eliminate red tape that prevents children from finding the help that they need, while the Housing Our Military Servicemembers (HOMeS) Act incentivizes local housing programs to support homeless veterans.    If you'd like to learn more about these bills, click here:  http://bit.ly/2BiOk32 http://bit.ly/2kzdLHc  I look forward to a day when homelessness is no longer plaguing our communities, but until then, the Homeless Hotline is an good resource supporting families and individuals resolve their housing crises 24 hours a day.   1-888-4SHELTR (1-888-474-3587)
May today be a peaceful and joyful day spent with those you love.  Merry Christmas.

We have to get unused prescriptions out of reach of those who would abuse them.
